Sonos Setup Assistant
Click "%2$s" to add one of these products, or click "%1$s" to do this later.
Click "%2$s" to try again, or click "%1$s" to register later.
You may change your preferences at any time by choosing "Preferences" from the Sonos menu, and selecting the "Usage" tab under "Advanced Settings."
If you want to change the default account, right-click (Ctrl+click) on %1$s in the Sonos music menu to select a different account.

After the Sonos Controller starts, please choose Sonos > Check for Updates…

To add Sonos Labs public beta services, you need to share usage data with Sonos.
To view or change your usage data setting, go to Sonos > Preferences > Advanced > Improve Sonos.
2. Go to "Sonos" > "Preferences" > "Advanced" and select "Wireless Setup."
You can try registering later in Help > Sonos System Registration.

The %1$s server did not recognize your login information.
Please make sure that your login (e-mail address or username) and your password are correct, press the Back button, and try again.
If the problem persists, please contact %2$s for help with your account.

Reset Controller
Resetting the controller will disconnect it from your Sonos system. When the controller restarts, you will be able to re-connect it, or connect it to a different Sonos system.
Update complete
You must first register your Sonos system to receive online software updates.
Checking Sonos for available updates…
The update has been canceled.
You may try again at any time by going to "Sonos" > "Check for Updates…"
Your Music Library Index needs to be rebuilt.
This operation can take some time.
While reindexing is happening, you will still be able to use your Music Library.

For best results, please set up the Sub using a controller in the same room. If this computer cannot be used in the same room as the Sub, it is recommended you choose “Not now” and complete setup with another controller.
Note: Make sure %1$s is plugged in to your TV’s HDMI ARC port.
Sonos > Preferences > Room Settings > %1$s > TV > TV Setup

'%1$s' is no longer available. The device where the music files are stored may not be powered on, or the path may have changed. Go to Manage > Music Library Settings to check the path name.
Searching for your Sonos System…
Go to System Preferences > Network and change to the network Sonos is on.
Sorry, we can’t connect to Sonos. Let’s try some things:
• Turn your Wi-Fi off and on.
• Unplug your router, then plug it back in.
• Check the power to your speakers.
• Restart your computer and try again.
